Bon, mon avis sur ce jeu est vraiment partagÃ©. Autant, le jeu est super fun en partie personnalisÃ©e avec des potes, autant en ligne... Ã§a varie bcp selon les circonstances. 

Pour faire simple, quand tu es survivant, tu peux rencontrer des tueurs toxiques qui campent/tunnel et jouent des tueurs OP et/ou ennuyant, et Ã©galement des alliÃ©s de merde qui se laissent tuer au premier crochet quand ils se sont fait avoir ou ne t'aident absolument pas et joue solo. Et Ã  l'inverse en tant que tueur, tu tombes souvent sur des survivants en groupe arrangÃ© qui ont parfois 2x ton level, jouent cancer Ã  la flashlight et tu te fais T-bag Ã  la fin.  

Ne parlons pas des trÃ¨s NOMBREUX bugs au niveau des hitboxs encore plus douteuse que sur un jeu FPS ou des serveurs parfois en carton. SÃ©rieux, les dÃ©veloppeurs semblent ne pas en branler une pour rÃ©gler ces problÃ¨mes majeurs qui datent encore et encore... 

Le systÃ¨me commercial du jeu est aussi plus que grossier. Tout doit s'acheter dans ce jeu. Si tu veux jouer d'autres tueurs ou survivants avec leurs compÃ©tences respectifs et pouvoir faire des mÃ©langes de builds, tu dois acheter. Pas avec l'argent du jeu, non... Mais avec du VRAI cash. Faut voir tout les DLC... Ã§a fait presque un peu Pay-to-win d'un certains points de vue... 

Pourtant, le jeu a de bons points Ã  dÃ©velopper et y jouer en ligne avec des potes est fort amusant et jouissif (selon si tu tombes sur un tueur correct ou un connard). On peut parfois faire des rencontres et des games amusantes (toujours selon le tueur ou les survivants). 

Bref ! Jouez y en groupe, avec des amis, sinon go solo en tant que tueur. Mais, prÃ©parez vous Ã  un peu de dose de sel. On survivra ensemble qui sait... Ou bien je survivrai face Ã  vous. On se retrouve dans la brume noire !

Have had a lot of fun with the game but it still has a lot of issues. The game also has a very toxic community. A lot of the perks for the game are not balanced for both killers and survivors. Majority of my survivor games end up with me dying on first hook while the killer camps, and its only gotten worse since they added skilled based matchmaking which is broke. Playing late at night is a joke to because of the queue times trying to find a match.

Game is ok,it is fun.But as killer if you get premade survivers your dont have chance.And that is stupid.You should change that only 2 people can group together at least.Like this it is like they have cameras over the whole map.Saying each other where is the killer.And you cant do sshit on higher ranks.Also that flashllight is just stupid op item.That part is really stupid.Also matchmaking is terrible,only ranked games is also stupid.

I enjoy the game but it's unbalanced and full of campers and it can be entirely too enraging sometimes I had it on PlayStation and played for a good amount of time after getting it free about a year ago but stopped playing cause the campers were becoming too much and came back to it on PC to see if it's gotten any better and it has NOT. 
This most recent update with Pinhead especially tells me that the devs don't care about balancing the game at all every action you make as a survivor takes entirely too long even with the perk the speeds actions up and now you have Pinheads stupid ability hooking you every minute or so to stop you from doing anything at all unless you solve the puzzle box across the map from you and of course not every killer feels that bad to play against like the base game killer is fine and the one with the axes is fine to give a couple examples but you basically always get a game against one of the more OP characters or against someone who camps a hook or a set of generators. 
It can be fun for a couple rounds but after dealing with too many campers or a few OP characters and it becomes unfun to the point of wanting to quit for the day or longer. 
I suggest only play with at least one or more friends and avoid playing alone at all cost cause playing with randoms only makes it even worse otherwise just don't play this at all.

Having started playing this on Playstation in 2017 I can say i highly recommend this game. It does have a bit of a learning curb and can cause quite the frustration whilst your getting the fundamentals down pact however practice makes perfect.
No match is ever the same and it is far easier playing with friends but not a necessity, just expect a lot of variety between the types of players your paired with and their abilities. 
The community has quite a large toxic component which typically tends to be towards the better ranked players however there is a lot of great people. Overall the game is great for just about all ages in terms of playability. My kids enjoy and do quite well.

If your new try find a discord community to play with some folks in swf, or party chat on console as it does make it easier. It is also a highly streamed game with plenty of opportunity to watch and meet people that way to play with aswell. Lastly its a game that keeps on giving and your always learning.
if you grow the balls this is such a fun game
I have to include a comment.

This game had soo much potential but somehow the devs make it worse every patch,the servers are a mess matchmaking is a mess theres no casual mode witch would help balance mmr killers are nerfed every single patch not one has any fear or intimidation thed closest you get is '' no counter play ''  bs baby survivors love spounting.
Nerfing new killers on release that were ''lackluster'' in the beta is the worst decision the devs could finnancialy and for the heath of the game/playerbase and yet they've done it every single time since legion.
This game survives on 2 things the new killers they bring out every 3 to 4 months and the ''hats'' they release with it, and a week later the playerbase drops from 60 to 80% until the next killer is releassed all while still having massive game breaking bugs 2 years later like the sound bug but hey that only affects the killer playerbase so who cares.
Eventually enof of the killer playerbase will stop starting the game to affect the servers and wait time and when that happens have fun making survivors play killer on mass atleast enof to make it look normal.
This game has caused more suffering than anything else I have ever experienced in my entire life.

I don't usually write reviews, but the matchmaking of this game is ridiculous. I'm new to this game and playing solo as a new player sucks. 90% of the time I got matched with really good players who destroy me as a killer. They have full purple perks while I have no points left to level my killers, so I can only use one perk. Because they are so much better, they start teabagging etc., killing my fun. Why is there a level system when the game matches me against more experienced players anyway? 

As a survivor, I also got wrecked most of the time, but sometimes my better random teammates carried me through the game. This is really frustrating.

But playing a lobby with 4 friends who suck as hard as you is actually fun. I would not recommend this game for people who want to play solo, but only for people who have a group of friends playing with them.
this is one of the most fun games I have ever played, it rarely has hackers in my 104 hours of playing I have only seen 1 hacker, there's no bugs or glitches I recommend playing this game
The doctor prescribed me to play this game to raise my blood pressure since it was at critically low levels. 10/10 would tilt again.

Muy buen juego, es muy divertido, requiere bastante habilidad para el asesino como superviviente. Lo unico malo es que tiene una comunidad bastante toxica, ya que en cada partida no puede faltar 1 toxico.

This game scratches a very interesting itch for me.  Shouldn't be looked at as a hardcore competitive game, so you're time spent wont be taxing.  Aside from that the game is always in dire need of polish and bug fixing.  The devs care but not enough and sometimes I question their ability to design the game.  But I do enjoy it even with the horrendous new mmr system everyone hates.  Haven't really had a problem but I don't mind sweating to win lol.  It's a love/hate game,  base your decision to buy on being able to tolerate let downs but getting that high when your focus aligns and you wipe either the killer or survivors.
